column4: if it doesnt show up in dmesg, how do i know what /dev device is assigned to a usb device?
If you want the device name in /dev, you can always: sudo fdisk -l to list available devices
no the garmin usb gps doesn't show up in an fdisk partition list
There's a program called GpsDrive which may be able to identify the device.
I have an idea... Check your /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist file
I'd consider guntbert's comment, also make sure the device isn't blacklisted under /etc/modprob.d/blacklist (#comment out blacklist garmin_gps -- if it exists)
yeah i think i saw garmin in there but not sure why usb wouldn't recognize it unless the blacklist thing prevents it
if i comment out the black list line, do i have to restart anything?
no, just pulled the gps out and back in and it now assigns a tty dev; thanks a lot for your help
if you ever have the need to mess with gps beware ... they all have proprietary extensions and gpsd is a huge pain with certain devices
I'll keep that in mind. Sounds like hell.
my test python script works ... thanks again
